back_cards.definition_en: The fifth day of the week, following Thursday.
back_cards.example_en: I always go to the movies on Friday nights.

back_cards.definition_en: A day often associated with the end of the workweek.
back_cards.example_en: She finished her project just in time for Friday.

back_cards.definition_en: A day for casual dress in some workplaces.
back_cards.example_en: Our office has a 'casual Friday' policy.

back_cards.definition_en: A day for social gatherings or events.
back_cards.example_en: The community hosts a farmers' market every Friday.

back_cards.definition_en: A day referenced in religious or cultural contexts.
back_cards.example_en: Good Friday is an important day in the Christian calendar.

back_cards.definition_en: A person licensed to practice law.
back_cards.example_en: She hired an attorney to handle her divorce case.

back_cards.definition_en: A professional who represents clients in court.
back_cards.example_en: The attorney presented strong evidence to the jury.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who provides legal advice.
back_cards.example_en: I consulted my attorney before signing the contract.

back_cards.definition_en: A person acting on behalf of another in legal matters.
back_cards.example_en: The attorney negotiated a settlement for the client.

back_cards.definition_en: A specialist in a specific area of law.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a criminal defense attorney with years of experience.

back_cards.definition_en: Except if; used to introduce a condition.
back_cards.example_en: You can’t go to the party unless you finish your homework.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating an exception to a statement.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll be there on time unless there’s traffic.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to specify a prerequisite.
back_cards.example_en: We won’t start the meeting unless everyone arrives.

back_cards.definition_en: Introducing a hypothetical situation.
back_cards.example_en: Unless it rains, we’ll have a picnic tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: Clarifying a negative outcome without a condition.
back_cards.example_en: She won’t pass the exam unless she studies hard.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to introduce a further negative statement.
back_cards.example_en: He didn’t call, nor did he text me.

back_cards.definition_en: Connecting two negative alternatives.
back_cards.example_en: I have neither the time nor the money to travel.

back_cards.definition_en: Emphasizing absence of multiple things.
back_cards.example_en: She brought no food nor drinks to the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in formal or literary contexts.
back_cards.example_en: Nor shall we surrender to fear.

back_cards.definition_en: Reinforcing a negative condition.
back_cards.example_en: I won’t go, nor should you.

back_cards.definition_en: A person with specialized knowledge or skill.
back_cards.example_en: The expert fixed my computer in minutes.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone consulted for professional advice.
back_cards.example_en: We hired a financial expert to manage our investments.

back_cards.definition_en: A recognized authority in a field.
back_cards.example_en: She’s an expert in marine biology.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who excels in a specific activity.
back_cards.example_en: He’s an expert at solving crossword puzzles.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who trains others in their expertise.
back_cards.example_en: The expert led a workshop on public speaking.

back_cards.definition_en: The arrangement or framework of something.
back_cards.example_en: The structure of the building is very modern.

back_cards.definition_en: A system or organization.
back_cards.example_en: The company’s structure includes several departments.

back_cards.definition_en: The composition of a text or speech.
back_cards.example_en: Her essay has a clear structure with an introduction and conclusion.

back_cards.definition_en: A physical construction or form.
back_cards.example_en: The bridge’s structure was damaged in the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: The way parts are organized in a process.
back_cards.example_en: The structure of the course includes weekly quizzes.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan for managing income and expenses.
back_cards.example_en: I created a budget to save for a new car.

back_cards.definition_en: The amount of money allocated for a purpose.
back_cards.example_en: The project has a budget of $10,000.

back_cards.definition_en: A financial limit for an organization.
back_cards.example_en: The city council approved the annual budget.

back_cards.definition_en: A personal spending plan.
back_cards.example_en: She sticks to her budget to avoid debt.

back_cards.definition_en: Funds set aside for a specific event.
back_cards.example_en: Our wedding budget covers food and decorations.

back_cards.definition_en: A contract to protect against financial loss.
back_cards.example_en: I bought car insurance to cover accidents.

back_cards.definition_en: A system to manage risks.
back_cards.example_en: Health insurance helps pay for medical bills.

back_cards.definition_en: Protection for property or assets.
back_cards.example_en: Home insurance covered the damage from the fire.

back_cards.definition_en: A policy for personal security.
back_cards.example_en: Life insurance provides for my family’s future.

back_cards.definition_en: A business or industry term.
back_cards.example_en: The insurance company processed my claim quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: Written or printed words.
back_cards.example_en: The text of the book was easy to read.

back_cards.definition_en: A message sent electronically.
back_cards.example_en: I got a text from my friend about the party.

back_cards.definition_en: The main body of a document.
back_cards.example_en: The report’s text explains the findings clearly.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of information or study.
back_cards.example_en: This history text is used in schools.

back_cards.definition_en: A short excerpt or quote.
back_cards.example_en: She shared a text from her favorite poem.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of being free or unrestricted.
back_cards.example_en: Freedom of speech is a fundamental right.

back_cards.definition_en: Independence from control or oppression.
back_cards.example_en: The country fought for its freedom.

back_cards.definition_en: The ability to make personal choices.
back_cards.example_en: I enjoy the freedom to work from home.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of liberation in daily life.
back_cards.example_en: Traveling gives her a sense of freedom.

back_cards.definition_en: Absence of constraints in creativity.
back_cards.example_en: Artists need freedom to express their ideas.

back_cards.definition_en: Wild or unpredictable.
back_cards.example_en: The party last night was absolutely crazy.

back_cards.definition_en: Unusual or surprising.
back_cards.example_en: It’s crazy how fast time flies.

back_cards.definition_en: Extremely enthusiastic or excited.
back_cards.example_en: She’s crazy about her new puppy.

back_cards.definition_en: Irrational or foolish.
back_cards.example_en: It was a crazy idea to climb that mountain.

back_cards.definition_en: Intense or extreme.
back_cards.example_en: The store was crazy busy during the sale.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who reads books or texts.
back_cards.example_en: She’s an avid reader of mystery novels.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who interprets or analyzes.
back_cards.example_en: The reader of the poem found deep meaning in it.

back_cards.definition_en: A device for accessing digital content.
back_cards.example_en: I use an e-reader to download books.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who reviews written material.
back_cards.example_en: The editor asked a reader for feedback.

back_cards.definition_en: A student learning to read.
back_cards.example_en: The teacher helped the young reader with new words.

back_cards.definition_en: A distinctive manner of expression.
back_cards.example_en: Her writing style is clear and engaging.

back_cards.definition_en: A fashion or appearance.
back_cards.example_en: I love the vintage style of her clothes.

back_cards.definition_en: A way of doing something.
back_cards.example_en: His teaching style makes learning fun.

back_cards.definition_en: A category of art or design.
back_cards.example_en: The house is built in a modern style.

back_cards.definition_en: A personal flair or approach.
back_cards.example_en: She dances with such unique style.

back_cards.definition_en: Moving from one side to another.
back_cards.example_en: We walked through the park to get home.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating a process or means.
back_cards.example_en: I found the job through a friend.

back_cards.definition_en: During a period of time.
back_cards.example_en: She worked through the night to finish.

back_cards.definition_en: Completing something.
back_cards.example_en: He read through the entire book in one day.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating a connection or passage.
back_cards.example_en: The call went through after several tries.

back_cards.definition_en: The third month of the year.
back_cards.example_en: My birthday is in March.

back_cards.definition_en: A time associated with spring.
back_cards.example_en: March brings warmer weather to the region.

back_cards.definition_en: A period for events or holidays.
back_cards.example_en: St. Patrick’s Day is celebrated in March.

back_cards.definition_en: A reference in historical contexts.
back_cards.example_en: The march of 1963 was a historic event.

back_cards.definition_en: A season for certain activities.
back_cards.example_en: March is a busy time for basketball fans.

back_cards.definition_en: A mechanical device that performs tasks.
back_cards.example_en: The washing machine broke down yesterday.

back_cards.definition_en: A complex system or organization.
back_cards.example_en: The company runs like a well-oiled machine.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool used in manufacturing.
back_cards.example_en: The factory uses machines to cut metal.

back_cards.definition_en: A computer or electronic device.
back_cards.example_en: This machine processes data very quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: A vehicle or heavy equipment.
back_cards.example_en: The construction machine dug a deep hole.

back_cards.definition_en: The eleventh month of the year.
back_cards.example_en: It gets cold in November.

back_cards.definition_en: A time for holidays like Thanksgiving.
back_cards.example_en: We gather with family every November.

back_cards.definition_en: A month associated with fall.
back_cards.example_en: The leaves fall heavily in November.

back_cards.definition_en: A period for elections in some countries.
back_cards.example_en: The vote takes place in November.

back_cards.definition_en: A season for certain events.
back_cards.example_en: November is known for charity runs.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people born around the same time.
back_cards.example_en: My generation grew up with smartphones.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of producing something.
back_cards.example_en: The generation of electricity is costly.

back_cards.definition_en: A stage in a family lineage.
back_cards.example_en: This recipe has been passed down for generations.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of time, about 20-30 years.
back_cards.example_en: Technology changes with each generation.

back_cards.definition_en: A category of products or ideas.
back_cards.example_en: The new generation of cars is eco-friendly.

back_cards.definition_en: Money received regularly for work or investments.
back_cards.example_en: Her income comes from her teaching job.

back_cards.definition_en: Financial earnings of a business.
back_cards.example_en: The company’s income increased this year.

back_cards.definition_en: Funds available for personal use.
back_cards.example_en: He budgets his income carefully.

back_cards.definition_en: Revenue from various sources.
back_cards.example_en: Rental properties provide extra income.

back_cards.definition_en: A measure of economic status.
back_cards.example_en: Their household income supports a comfortable life.

back_cards.definition_en: Came into existence through birth.
back_cards.example_en: She was born in a small village.

back_cards.definition_en: Originating from a specific time or place.
back_cards.example_en: He was born in the 1980s.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a natural talent or quality.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a born leader.

back_cards.definition_en: Resulting from a particular situation.
back_cards.example_en: The idea was born during a meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Associated with a cultural identity.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a born New Yorker.

back_cards.definition_en: To confess or acknowledge something.
back_cards.example_en: He admitted his mistake to the teacher.

back_cards.definition_en: To allow entry or access.
back_cards.example_en: The ticket admits two people to the concert.

back_cards.definition_en: To accept someone into an institution.
back_cards.example_en: She was admitted to the university.

back_cards.definition_en: To concede a point or fact.
back_cards.example_en: I admit that you were right.

back_cards.definition_en: To permit as valid.
back_cards.example_en: The court admitted the evidence.

back_cards.definition_en: A greeting used when meeting someone.
back_cards.example_en: She said hello to her neighbor.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to answer the phone.
back_cards.example_en: He picked up and said, 'Hello?'

back_cards.definition_en: An expression to get attention.
back_cards.example_en: Hello, can you hear me?

back_cards.definition_en: A casual way to start a conversation.
back_cards.example_en: Hello, how’s it going?

back_cards.definition_en: A polite acknowledgment.
back_cards.example_en: She waved and said hello to the crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: Moving to a position on a surface.
back_cards.example_en: The cat jumped onto the table.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating awareness or discovery.
back_cards.example_en: She’s onto our secret plan.

back_cards.definition_en: Transitioning to a new topic or task.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s move onto the next agenda item.

back_cards.definition_en: Directing toward a destination.
back_cards.example_en: He climbed onto the roof.

back_cards.definition_en: Attaching or connecting to something.
back_cards.example_en: I copied the files onto a USB drive.

back_cards.definition_en: A large body of saltwater.
back_cards.example_en: The sea was calm during our boat trip.

back_cards.definition_en: A vast expanse or area.
back_cards.example_en: The festival attracted a sea of people.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of marine resources.
back_cards.example_en: Fishermen depend on the sea for their livelihood.

back_cards.definition_en: A setting for adventure or travel.
back_cards.example_en: He sailed across the sea to new lands.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphor for something vast or mysterious.
back_cards.example_en: Her eyes were as deep as the sea.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of agreement or acceptance.
back_cards.example_en: Okay, I’ll meet you at six.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating something is satisfactory.
back_cards.example_en: The food here is okay, but not amazing.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to confirm understanding.
back_cards.example_en: Okay, so we’re repeating the plan tomorrow?

back_cards.definition_en: Used to reassure or calm.
back_cards.example_en: It’s okay, don’t worry about it.

back_cards.definition_en: A pause or transition in speech.
back_cards.example_en: Okay, let’s get started with the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: The opening in the face used for eating and speaking.
back_cards.example_en: She covered her mouth when she yawned.

back_cards.definition_en: The entrance to a river or harbor.
back_cards.example_en: The ship sailed to the mouth of the river.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to express verbal communication.
back_cards.example_en: Word of mouth helped spread the news.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of an animal’s anatomy.
back_cards.example_en: The dog carried the bone in its mouth.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphorical expression of capacity.
back_cards.example_en: He has a big mouth and loves to talk.

back_cards.definition_en: In every part of a place or thing.
back_cards.example_en: Flowers were planted throughout the garden.

back_cards.definition_en: During the entire time of an event.
back_cards.example_en: She stayed cheerful throughout the day.

back_cards.definition_en: Across a wide range or area.
back_cards.example_en: The news spread throughout the city.

back_cards.definition_en: In all aspects or sections.
back_cards.example_en: The book is engaging throughout.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating consistent presence.
back_cards.example_en: Support was available throughout the project.

back_cards.definition_en: Belonging to oneself or itself.
back_cards.example_en: I have my own apartment now.

back_cards.definition_en: Done or made by oneself.
back_cards.example_en: She built her own website from scratch.

example_en: He has his own unique perspective on life.
Each student needs their own book.
I saw it with my own eyes.

back_cards.definition_en: An examination or evaluation.
back_cards.example_en: I have a math test tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: A procedure to check functionality.
back_cards.example_en: The technician ran a test on the engine.

back_cards.definition_en: A trial to prove something.
back_cards.example_en: The new drug passed the clinical test.

example_en.example_en: The obstacle course was a real test.
The test showed her skills had improved.

back_cards.definition_en: A network created by a spider.
back_cards.example_en: A spider spun a web in the corner.

example_en.example_en: I found it on a website.

example_en: The web is a web of lies.
definition_en: A structure connecting ideas or data.
example_en: The web of relationships in the story was intriguing.
Social media is a vast web of connections.

back_cards.definition_en: To move back and forth quickly.
back_cards.example_en: Shake the bottle before opening it.

example_en.example_en: The ground began to shake during the earthquake.

example_en: The news shook her deeply.
definition_en: To mix or blend by shaking.
example_en: He shook the cocktail shaker to mix the drink.
definition_en: To get rid of or dislodge.
example_en: She shook the dust off her jacket.

back_cards.definition_en: A statement of intent to harm.
back_cards.example_en: The bully made a threat to fight after school.

example_en.example_en: Climate change is a serious threat to wildlife.

example_en: Dark clouds were a threat of rain.
The government addressed the threat of cyberattacks.
The wildfire was a threat to nearby homes.

back_cards.definition_en: An answer to a problem.
back_cards.example_en: We found a solution to the puzzle.

example_en.definition_en: A method to resolve a situation.
example_en.example_en: The solution was to hire more staff.

example_en: The scientist mixed a chemical solution.
definition_en: A way to address a challenge.
example_en: Her solution was to start early.
The treaty was a peaceful solution.

back_cards.definition_en: To close something tightly.
back_cards.example_en: Please shut the door quietly.

example_en.example_en: The factory shut down last year.

example_en: They shut the gates to keep out intruders.
She shut the argument with a firm response.
definition_en: To close off emotionally or socially.
example_en: He shut himself away after the loss.

back_cards.definition_en: Toward a lower position or level.
back_cards.example_en: The ball rolled down the hill.

example_en.definition_en: In a reduced or lesser state.
example_en.example_en: The music volume was turned down.

example_en: She walked down to the store.
He wrote down the instructions.
definition_en: In a state of sadness or failure.
example_en: She felt down after the bad news.

back_cards.definition_en: To go from one place to another.
back_cards.example_en: They love to travel to new countries.

example_en.definition_en: To move or journey over a distance.
example_en.example_en: Light travels faster than sound.

definition_en: To explore or tour for leisure.
example_en: She travels to see historical sites.
definition_en: To commute or move for work.
example_en: He travels daily for his job.
News travels fast in a small town.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who studies or works in science.
back_cards.example_en: The scientist discovered a new planet.

example_en.definition_en: An expert in a specific field.
example_en.example_en: She’s a scientist specializing in genetics.

example_en: The scientist tested the water for pollution.
Scientists are studying climate patterns.
definition_en: A professional in a lab or academic setting.
example_en: The scientist published a groundbreaking paper.

back_cards.definition_en: To conceal oneself from view.
back_cards.example_en: The cat loves to hide under the bed.

example_en.definition_en: To keep something out of sight.
example_en.example_en: She hid the gift in the closet.

example_en: The fog hid the mountain from view.
definition_en: To avoid revealing emotions or truths.
example_en: He tried to hide his disappointment.
The thief hid from the police.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that is easily seen or understood.
back_cards.example_en: She was obviously upset about the news.

example_en.definition_en: Used to emphasize a clear fact.
example_en.example_en: Obviously, you need to practice more.

definition_en: In an apparent or noticeable manner.
example_en: The solution was obviously correct.
It’s obviously going to rain soon.
Obviously, we need to plan ahead.

back_cards.definition_en: To mention or direct attention to.
back_cards.example_en: She referred to the book in her speech.

example_en.definition_en: To consult or look up information.
example_en.example_en: I referred to the manual for instructions.

definition_en: To send someone to a source or person.
example_en: The doctor referred her to a specialist.
The term refers to a specific concept.
This rule only refers to new members.

back_cards.definition_en: Being by oneself without others.
back_cards.example_en: She prefers to work alone.

example_en.definition_en: Without help or support from others.
example_en.example_en: He built the project alone.

example_en: She felt alone after her friends left.
Her talent stands alone in the industry.
This offer is available alone to members.

back_cards.definition_en: To consume a liquid through the mouth.
back_cards.example_en: I drink coffee every morning.

example_en.definition_en: To take in or absorb moisture.
example_en.example_en: The plant drinks up water quickly.

example_en: They drink wine at dinner.
definition_en: To toast or celebrate with a beverage.
example_en: Let’s drink to the happy couple!
He drank in the beauty of the sunset.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal inquiry or examination.
back_cards.example_en: The police launched an investigation into the theft.

example_en.example_en: Her investigation revealed new insights.

example_en: The investigation took several weeks.
definition_en: A review of a situation or issue.
example_en: The company conducted a safety investigation.
The report was based on thorough investigation.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a legislative senate.
back_cards.example_en: The senator voted on the new bill.

example_en.example_en: The senator addressed the nation’s concerns.

example_en: She’s been a senator for ten years.
The senator spoke eloquently at the hearing.
definition_en: A figure in state or national politics.
example_en: The senator campaigned for education reform.

back_cards.definition_en: A single item or component.
back_cards.example_en: The kit comes with one unit.

example_en.definition_en: A group or team working together.
example_en.example_en: The military unit trained daily.

definition_en: A section of a larger system.
example_en: The building has a heating unit.
The recipe calls for one unit of sugar.
definition_en: A module in education or training.
example_en: We finished the first unit of the course.

back_cards.definition_en: An image captured by a camera.
back_cards.example_en: She framed a photograph of her family.

example_en.example_en: The photograph captured the sunset perfectly.

definition_en: A piece of art or documentation.
example_en: His photographs were displayed in a gallery.
definition_en: A record of a historical event.
example_en: The photograph showed the old town square.
I took a photograph of my dog.

back_cards.definition_en: The seventh month of the year.
back_cards.example_en: July is a popular time for vacations.

example_en.example_en: It’s always warm in July.

example_en: July 4th is Independence Day in the U.S.
We go camping every July.
definition_en: A season for festivals or events.
example_en: The music festival happens in July.

back_cards.definition_en: A device for receiving broadcast signals.
back_cards.example_en: We watched the game on television.

example_en.definition_en: A medium for entertainment and news.
example_en.example_en: Television shows a variety of programs.

example_en: She works in television production.
The news on television reported the storm.
Television has changed how we spend evenings.

back_cards.definition_en: A metal object used to unlock something.
back_cards.example_en: I lost the key to my car.

example_en.example_en: Hard work is the key to success.

definition_en: A button or control on a device.
example_en: Press the enter key to submit.
The song is in the key of C.
The map includes a key for symbols.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to physical attraction or intimacy.
back_cards.example_en: The movie has a sexual theme.

example_en.example_en: The study focused on sexual health.

example_en: Their relationship became sexual over time.
Sexual dimorphism is common in birds.
The group discussed sexual identity issues.

back_cards.definition_en: A device for receiving broadcast signals.
back_cards.example_en: I listen to the radio in the car.

example_en.definition_en: A medium for music and talk shows.
example_en.example_en: Her favorite station plays pop music.

example_en: The pilot used the radio to contact the tower.
He’s a host on a popular radio show.
definition_en: A source of news or alerts.
example_en: The radio announced a traffic update.

back_cards.definition_en: To stop something from happening.
back_cards.example_en: We took steps to prevent accidents.

example_en.definition_en: To keep someone from doing something.
example_en.example_en: The lock prevented unauthorized entry.

definition_en: To avoid or reduce the risk of.
example_en: Vaccines help prevent diseases.
Rain prevented us from hiking.
Sunscreen helps prevent sunburn.

back_cards.definition_en: A single time in the past.
back_cards.example_en: I met her once at a party.

example_en.example_en: Once you finish, we can leave.

example_en: This place was once a forest.
I only saw the movie once.
definition_en: In a former time or state.
example_en: She was once a famous actress.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the present or recent times.
back_cards.example_en: The museum has a modern design.

example_en.definition_en: Using the latest technology or ideas.
example_en.example_en: Modern medicine has improved lives.

example_en: She wears modern fashion.
The school uses modern teaching methods.
His modern approach surprised everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: A legislative body in a government.
back_cards.example_en: The senate voted on the law yesterday.

example_en.example_en: The senate debated the budget.

definition_en: A governing council in ancient times.
example_en: The Roman Senate was powerful.
definition_en: A decision-making body in an organization.
example_en: The university senate approved new courses.
She spoke at the senator.

back_cards.definition_en: Physical force causing harm.
back_cards.example_en: The protest turned into violence.

example_en.example_en: The storm’s violence uprooted trees.

example_en: Words can cause as much violence as actions.
definition_en: A theme in media or news.
example_en: The movie depicted gang violence.
Such injustice is a violence to fairness.

back_cards.definition_en: To make physical contact with.
back_cards.example_en: Don’t touch the wet paint.

example_en.example_en: Her speech touched everyone’s hearts.

example_en: He hasn’t touched his homework yet.
The temperature touched 90 degrees today.
This issue doesn’t touch our department.

back_cards.definition_en: A distinctive characteristic.
back_cards.example_en: The car’s best feature is its mileage.

example_en.example_en: The mountain is a feature of the landscape.

example_en: The app has a new chat feature.
The festival’s main feature was the concert.
definition_en: A segment in media or journalism.
example_en: The feature on local artists was inspiring.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people watching a performance.
back_cards.example_en: The audience clapped after the play.

example_en.example_en: The book has a wide audience.

example_en: She addressed the audience confidently.
definition_en: A target group for a product.
example_en: The ad reached a global audience.
The king granted an audience to the envoy.

back_cards.definition_en: The time between afternoon and night.
back_cards.example_en: We had dinner in the evening.

example_en.definition_en: A time for relaxation or socializing.
example_en.example_en: I spend evenings with friends at a café.

example_en: The evening was hosted at the museum.
definition_en: The later part of the day.
example_en: Evening classes start at 6 PM.
The sunset made the evening serene.

back_cards.definition_en: The objective case of a person referred to.
back_cards.example_en: To whom should I send the package?

example_en.definition_en: Used in formal questions about a person.
example_en.example_en: Whom did you meet at the conference?

definition_en: A relative pronoun in a clause.
example_en: The man whom I saw was my teacher.
definition_en: Indicating a person receiving an action.
example_en: She’s the one whom he loves.
To whom it may concern:.

back_cards.definition_en: The forward part of something.
back_cards.example_en: The front of the house faces the street.

example_en.example_en: She stood at the front of the line.

example_en: He put on a brave front despite his fears.
A cold front brought rain today.
The front of the book has a colorful cover.

back_cards.definition_en: A corridor or passageway.
back_cards.example_en: The classrooms are down the hall.

example_en.example_en: The wedding was held in a banquet hall.

example_en: The town hall hosts community events.
She lives in a dorm hall at college.
definition_en: A place of honor or fame.
example_en: He was inducted into the Hall of Fame.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of work to be done.
back_cards.example_en: My task is to clean the kitchen.

example_en.example_en: The team was given a challenging task.

example_en: Learning a language is a big task.
The first task was to gather materials.
Her task involves managing social media.

back_cards.definition_en: The number of points in a game.
back_cards.example_en: The final score was 3 to 1.

example_en.example_en: The movie’s score was unforgettable.

example_en: Her test score was perfect.
The table had a score from a knife.
A score years ago, we started.

back_cards.definition_en: The outer covering of a body.
back_cards.example_en: Her skin is sensitive to the sun.

example_en.example_en: The leather is made from the finest skins.

example_en: Peel the skin before eating the apple.
The paint forms a skin on the surface.
She feels comfortable in her own skin.

back_cards.definition_en: To experience pain or distress.
back_cards.example_en: He suffers from chronic migraines.

example_en.example_en: The city suffered during the war.

example_en: Her grades suffered due to stress.
I can’t suffer his constant complaints.
The crops suffered from the frost.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a great extent from side to side.
back_cards.example_en: The river is very wide here.

example_en.example_en: She has a wide range of skills.

example_en: His eyes were wide with surprise.
The news had a wide impact.
The wide hallway led to the main room.

back_cards.definition_en: The season between spring and summer.
back_cards.example_en: Spring brings blooming flowers.

example_en.example_en: We hiked to a clear spring.

example_en: The mattress has strong springs.
definition_en: A time of growth or renewal.
example_en: The business saw a spring in profits.
The cat made a spring at the toy.

back_cards.definition_en: Knowledge gained through involvement.
back_cards.example_en: She has experience in marketing.

example_en.example_en: Traveling was a memorable experience.

definition_en: The process of living through something.
example_en: Experience teaches us valuable lessons.
The job requires five years of experience.
The concert was thrilling.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to citizens or community.
back_cards.example_en: Civil rights are important to her.

example_en.example_en: He gave a civil response despite disagreement.

example_en: The civil courts handle property disputes.
Civil unrest disrupted the city.
definition_en: Of or related to ordinary citizens.
example_en: The civil service employs thousands.

back_cards.definition_en: The condition of being protected.
back_cards.example_en: Safety is the priority at the construction site.

example_en.example_en: The car has advanced safety features.

definition_en: A set of precautions or measures.
example_en: Follow safety guidelines in the lab.
She found safety in her family’s support.
The helmet provides safety for cyclists.

back_cards.definition_en: The days at the end of the week.
back_cards.example_en: We went camping over the weekend.

example_en.definition_en: A time for rest or leisure.
example_en.example_en: I relax and read during weekends.

example_en: The weekend was a nice getaway.
definition_en: A time for events or outings.
example_en: The festival is happening this weekend.
definition_en: A break from work or school.
example_en: She studies on weekends to catch up.

back_cards.definition_en: During the time that.
back_cards.example_en: I read a book while waiting for the bus.

example_en.example_en: She loves tea while he prefers coffee.

example_en: Keep trying while you have strength.
While some left, others stayed.
He sang while cooking dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a specified value.
back_cards.example_en: This painting is worth a lot.

example_en.example_en: The trip was worth the long drive.

example_en: The book is worth its price.
It’s worth checking the reviews first.
Her advice was worth considering.

back_cards.definition_en: The name of a book, movie, or work.
back_cards.example_en: The title of the novel is intriguing.

example_en.example_en: The article’s title caught my eye.

example_en: She holds the title of manager.
He won the title in boxing.
The title to the land was disputed.

back_cards.definition_en: High temperature or warmth.
back_cards.example_en: The heat was intense during summer.

example_en.example_en: The stove generates heat for cooking.

example_en: The heat of the competition was overwhelming.
The heat wave lasted a week.
She advanced to the final heat.

back_cards.definition_en: Conforming to a standard or typical pattern.
back_cards.example_en: It’s normal to feel nervous before a test.

example_en.example_en: The weather is normal for spring.

example_en: His blood test results were normal.
Such behavior is normal among kids.
The situation returned to normal.

back_cards.definition_en: A feeling of expectation or desire.
back_cards.example_en: She has hope for a better future.

example_en.example_en: There’s hope we’ll finish early.

example_en: Her smile was a hope in tough times.
His hope is to become a doctor.
We hold hope for peace.

back_cards.definition_en: An outdoor area next to a house.
back_cards.example_en: The kids played in the yard.

example_en.definition_en: A unit of length equal to three feet.
example_en.example_en: The fabric was a yard long.

definition_en: A work area for specific activities.
example_en: The ship was built in a shipyard.
The lumber is kept in the yard.
She planted flowers in the yard.

back_cards.definition_en: One of the digits of the hand.
back_cards.example_en: She cut her finger while cooking.

example_en.example_en: A finger of land extended into the sea.

example_en: He pointed a finger at the map.
Add a finger of salt to the soup.
definition_en: A tool or part resembling a finger.
example_en: The machine has a finger-like grip.

back_cards.definition_en: To be inclined or likely.
back_cards.example_en: I tend to wake up early.

example_en.definition_en: To care for or look after.
example_en.example_en: She tends to her garden daily.

definition_en: To move in a certain direction.
example_en: The road tends to the north.
He tends the bar on weekends.
The nurse tends to the patients’ needs.

back_cards.definition_en: An important task or goal.
back_cards.example_en: The mission was to deliver supplies.

example_en.example_en: The ambassador led a peace mission.

example_en: The mission feeds the homeless daily.
The mission to Mars was successful.
Her mission is to educate others.

back_cards.definition_en: At some point in the future.
back_cards.example_en: We’ll get there eventually.

example_en.example_en: He tried many times and eventually succeeded.

example_en: The rain eventually stopped.
She eventually learned to drive.
Eventually, things will improve.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who takes part in something.
back_cards.example_en: She was a participant in the race.

example_en.example_en: Participants shared ideas at the workshop.

definition_en: A member of a group activity.
example_en: The study included 50 participants.
definition_en: An active player in a process.

back_cards.definition_en: A place offering lodging for travelers.
back_cards.example_en: We booked a room at the hotel.

definition_en.definition_en: A facility with dining or amenities.
definition_en.example_en: The hotel has a pool and spa.

example_en: The hotel chain operates globally.
definition_en: A venue for events or meetings.
example_en: The conference was held at the hotel.
The hotel was cozy and affordable.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who decides legal cases.
back_cards.example_en: The judge sentenced the defendant.

example_en.example_en: The judge scored the dance routine.

definition_en: A person who evaluates or critiques.
example_en: She’s a good judge of character.
The judge settled the argument fairly.
definition_en: A leader in a historical context.
example_en: The ancient judges ruled wisely.

back_cards.definition_en: A repeated decorative design.
back_cards.example_en: The wallpaper has a floral pattern.

example_en.example_en: I used a pattern to sew a dress.

example_en: The pattern of his work is consistent.
We noticed a pattern in the data.
The recipe follows a simple pattern.

back_cards.definition_en: To separate into pieces.
back_cards.example_en: The plate broke when it fell.

example_en.example_en: Let’s break for lunch now.

definition_en: To violate a rule or promise.
example_en: He broke the law by speeding.
The prisoner broke out of jail.
The bad news broke her spirit.

back_cards.definition_en: An established organization.
back_cards.example_en: The museum is a cultural institution.

example_en.definition_en: A place for care or education.
example_en.example_en: He studied at a prestigious institution.

definition_en: A system or custom in society.
example_en: Marriage is a social institution.
The institution houses elderly residents.

back_cards.definition_en: Belief in a higher power.
back_cards.example_en: Her faith gives her strength.

definition_en.example_en: I have faith in your abilities.

example_en: They practice their faith daily.
He kept faith with his promises.
definition_en: A sense of hope or belief.
example_en: Faith helped her through tough times.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a paid occupation.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a professional photographer.

example_en.example_en: His work is always professional.

example_en: The lawyer acted in a professional manner.
Professional athletes train daily.
Her presentation was very professional.

back_cards.definition_en: To show an image in a mirror or surface.
back_cards.example_en: The lake reflects the mountains.

example_en.example_en: She reflected on her past decisions.

example_en: His grades reflect his hard work.
definition_en: To bounce back, like light or sound.
example_en: The walls reflect sound clearly.
The art reflects cultural values.

back_cards.definition_en: People in general.
back_cards.example_en: The folk gathered for the festival.

example_en.example_en: The folk in the village are kind.

example_en: The folk here have unique traditions.
My folks are visiting this weekend.
definition_en: A genre of music or stories.
example_en: She loves singing folk songs.

back_cards.definition_en: The outer layer of something.
back_cards.example_en: The surface of the table is smooth.

example_en.definition_en: The top or exterior of a body.
example_en.example_en: The moon’s surface is covered in craters.

definition_en: The water level of a lake or sea.
example_en: Fish swam near the surface.
On the surface, he seems calm.
She cleaned every surface in the kitchen.

back_cards.definition_en: To drop or come down freely.
back_cards.example_en: The leaves fall in autumn.

example_en.example_en: He fell off the ladder.

example_en: The temperature fell overnight.
The event falls on a Tuesday.
The plan fell apart quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: A person using professional services.
back_cards.example_en: The lawyer met with a new client.

example_en.example_en: The store values its clients’ loyalty.

definition_en: A user of a service or system.
example_en: The app has millions of clients.
The therapist listened to her client.
The client signed the contract today.

back_cards.definition_en: The boundary or side of something.
back_cards.example_en: The cup was on the edge of the table.

example_en.example_en: The knife’s edge was razor-sharp.

example_en: Her skills gave her an edge in the competition.
He was on edge before the exam.
They camped at the edge of the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: Based on long-established customs.
back_cards.example_en: They wore traditional clothing for the festival.

example_en.example_en: The recipe is a traditional family dish.

example_en: The school follows traditional teaching methods.
Traditional music filled the air.
He prefers traditional paper books.

back_cards.definition_en: A group that advises or governs.
back_cards.example_en: The city council approved the budget.

example_en.example_en: The council met to plan the event.

example_en: The student council organized the dance.
The council fixed the roads.
definition_en: A committee for a specific purpose.
example_en: The safety council issued new guidelines.
